West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm
New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

Drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, due to station improvements. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
L Line - Weeknight Planned Service Change

11:45 PM to 5 AM, Tue to Fri, Jan 3 - 6 No L trains between 8 Av and 14 St-Union Sq, due to track replacement. M14 buses provide alternate service. L service operates between Rockaway Pkwy and 14 St-Union Sq. M14 buses make all L stops between 8 Av and 14 St-Union Sq. Transfer between trains and buses at 14 St-Union Sq.
Alcohol Ban on Trains & at Stations New Year's Eve/Day

Drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police.
J Line - Weekday Planned Service Changes

10 AM to 3 PM, Tue to Fri, Jan 3 - 6 J trains run every 20 minutes between Jamaica Center and 111 St and the last stop for some trains headed toward Jamaica Center is 111 St, due to track maintenance. To continue your trip, transfer at 111 St to a Jamaica Center-bound J. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.
F Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

NIGHTS 12:01 AM to 5 AM, Wed to Fri, Jan 4 - 6 F service operates in two sections, due to track maintenance: 1. Between 179 St and Jay St-MetroTech, and via the A to/from Hoyt-Schermerhorn Sts. 2. Between Stillwell Av and Bergen St, and via the G to/from Bedford-Nostrand Avs. To continue your trip, transfer at Hoyt-Schermerhorn Sts. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs. DAYS 7:30 AM to 9 AM, Wed to Fri, Jan 4 - 6 3:45 PM to 6 PM, Wed to Fri, Jan 4 - 6 Some Jamaica-bound F trains skip Smith-9 Sts, Carroll St, and Bergen St, due to track maintenance. All times until early 2017 Coney Island-bound F trains skip Avenue I, Bay Pkwy, Avenue N, Avenue P, Avenue U, and Avenue X, due to station improvements. To these stations, take the Coney Island-bound F to Kings Hwy or Neptune Av and transfer to a Jamaica-bound F. From these stations, take a Jamaica-bound F to Kings Hwy or 18 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound F.
E Line - Weeknight Planned Service Change

Alcohol Ban on Trains & at Stations New Year's Eve/Day

Drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police.
West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm
New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm

New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm
Alcohol Ban on Trains & at Stations New Year's Eve/Day

Drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police.

West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm
Babylon Branch Eastbound Train Operating 12 Minutes Late

New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm
West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm

West-of-Hudson New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Whether you plan on watching the ball drop in Times Square or you're ringing in the New Year quietly with friends we've got plenty of service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines to get you safely to your holiday celebrations. On Friday, December 30, we will operate regular weekday service. The regularly scheduled Pascack Valley Friday-only train will depart Hoboken at 2:58 p.m., and stop at Secaucus Junction, and select stations in New Jersey, and Pearl River, Nanuet and Spring Valley. On Saturday, December 31 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, January 1 we will operate a Sunday schedule with extra early morning departures on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines after midnight. On Monday, January 2 we will operate a Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. See details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/woh_holidayservice.htm
New Year's Eve Holiday Service (Dec. 30 - Jan. 2)

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. Look for early getaway service on Friday, December 30, with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On New Year's Eve (Saturday, December 31) we will operate a special schedule with extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home safely from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. Your first resolution for the New Year should be to buy your tickets in advance: Those of you taking our early morning New Year service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Start the New Year off right and resolve to use MTA eTix. On New Year's Day, Sunday, January 1, 2017 we will operate a Sunday schedule. Because businesses and government offices are closed on Monday, January 2, in official observance of New Year's Day, we will operate a Saturday schedule on Monday without the Shoppers Specials. See more details at: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 25 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm
Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 25 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

LIRR Operates on Normal Weekday Schedule Today, Dec. 26 - Off Peak Fares in Effect

LIRR will be operating on a normal weekday schedule today, December 26. Off-peak fares will be in effect, as well as the Railroad's Family Fare Discount. With the LIRR's Family Fare, kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Tickets must be purchased before boarding. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 25 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm
Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 25 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

LIRR Operates on Normal Weekday Schedule Monday, Dec. 26 - Off Peak Fares in Effect

LIRR will be operating on a normal weekday schedule Monday, December 26. off-peak fares will be in effect, as well as the Railroad's Family Fare Discount. With the LIRR's Family Fare, kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Tickets must be purchased before boarding. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm
Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

LIRR will be operating on a normal weekday schedule Monday, December 26. off-peak fares will be in effect, as well as the Railroad's Family Fare Discount. With the LIRR's Family Fare, kids ages 5-11 (limit of 4 children) can ride one-way for $1 when accompanied by a fare paying parent or guardian. Tickets must be purchased before boarding. Weekly and monthly ticket holders pay just for the kids and, as always, children under 5 ride free.

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service gets you you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. - On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. - On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. - On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm
Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm
Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

N Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Changes

All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, due to station improvements. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
F Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

All times until early 2017 Coney Island-bound F trains skip Avenue I, Bay Pkwy, Avenue N, Avenue P, Avenue U, and Avenue X, due to station improvements. To these stations, take the Coney Island-bound F to Kings Hwy or Neptune Av and transfer to a Jamaica-bound F. From these stations, take a Jamaica-bound F to Kings Hwy or 18 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound F.

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm

Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm
West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm

Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm
West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service has all you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service gets you you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm

Metro-North's Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday Service (Dec. 23 - Jan. 2)

Who needs flying reindeer? Our West-of-Hudson Christmas/New Year's Holiday service gets you you'll need for getting around Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. (And you don't have to feed or clean up after us!) On Friday, December 23, early getaway trains will operate on both the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Sunday, December 25 we will operate regular Sunday schedule. On Monday, December 26 will operate a regular Saturday/Sunday/Holiday schedule. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/holidayservice.htm

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day.

Forget the One-Horse Open Sleigh! Metro-North is the best way to get around during this holiday season! We've got plenty of service, and a special timetable covering Christmas Day, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day. Take advantage of our Christmas Getaway Service on Friday, December 23 with extra trains departing Grand Central beginning at around 1 PM. On Christmas Eve Day, Saturday, December 24 we will operate a regular Saturday schedule. On Christmas Day, Sunday, December 25, we will operate a regular Sunday schedule. And since Christmas falls on a Sunday this year, many businesses will observe the holiday on Monday, December 26. On that day, we will operate a Saturday schedule with additional Shoppers' Specials trains. And look for our special New Year's Eve Service to get you safely to and from your celebrations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/christmas.htm

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 10 through noon on Sunday, December 11. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. SantaCon Alert: Alcohol banned on Metro-North trains & at stations from noon Dec. 10 - noon Dec. 11

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 10 through noon on Sunday, December 11. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police. See more details at http://bit.ly/2hnVMPT

SantaCon Alert: Alcohol banned on Metro-North trains & at stations from noon Dec. 10 - noon Dec. 11

To maintain orderly travel and safe station and terminal operations during this weekend's SantaCon event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and in stations from noon on Saturday, December 10 through noon on Sunday, December 11. MTA police officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and stations throughout the region, as well as on trains to enforce this restriction. The police will confiscate alcoholic beverages and issue summonses carrying fines or imprisonment. Violators may also be subject to removal from the train or station by police. See more details at http://bit.ly/2hnVMPT

The following planned service change is now ADDED: 10:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Dec 5 - 9 Coney Island-bound F trains skip Lexington Av/63 St. To this station, take the Coney Island-bound F to 47-50 Sts, transfer to a Jamaica-bound F* to Lexington Av/53 St, and transfer to an uptown 4 local or 6 to 59 St. From this station, take a downtown 4 local or 6 to 51 St, where F service is available at the E platform. *Jamaica-bound F trains are rerouted via the E after 47-50 Sts to Roosevelt Av nightly from 11:45 PM. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.
